column2: ITP approved for use by: Victor Mira
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: 20mm Class 3 bedding material conforms to specified requirements applicable to the class of product as detailed on the drawings.
○ Material is registered with VicRoads in accordance with Code of Practice RC500.02.
FREQUENCY: Once, for each mix design, prior to placement of material
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: ConQA Hold Point Release
REFERENCE: IFC Drawings, 703.05 (a), 703.07, MRPA Quality Management Plan
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Concrete mix meets strength, grade, and maximum aggregate size as detailed on the drawings.
○ Paving concrete mix conforms to AS1379.
○ SUP concrete mix is registered with VicRoads.
○ No air entraining chemical admixtures shall be used without approval from the Nominated Authority.
FREQUENCY: Once, for each mix design, prior to placement of concrete
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: ConQA Hold Point Release
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Reinforcement shall comply with AS4671.
○ Alternatively, provide a current ACRS certification for materials and for bar processing (as this covers a higher certification)
○ Note: ACRS certificate may cover both aspects or be for each separate portion (e.g 1 for the material supplier and another for the bar processor (bending, cropping and delivery)
FREQUENCY: Once for each supplier, prior to placement of order
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Details of evaporative retardant, application procedure (including application rates) to be submitted for review to the Nominated Authority.
FREQUENCY: Once, for each product, prior to placement of concrete
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Details of curing compound and NATA test certificate stating compliance with AS3799 no more than 3 years from issue, to be submitted for review to the Nominated Authority.
FREQUENCY: Once, for each product, prior to placement of concrete
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Attach Marked drawing indicating the location of this Lot
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Check the revision of the IFC drawings are current as per the drawing register (on Teambinder)
FREQUENCY: Prior to starting Works and at regular intervals
REFERENCE: IFC Drawings, COGD SD300 Series
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The work shall be constructed in accordance with the confirmed set out to the line and level and cross-sectional profiles as shown on the drawings.
○ The Nominated Authority will review and confirm the set out.
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: ConQA Hold Point Release
REFERENCE: IFC Drawings, COGD SD300 Series
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Excavation shall be to a sufficient depth to allow for the required compacted thickness of bedding material under the full width of concrete paving.
○ Where it is necessary to excavate existing pavement, the excavation shall not extend more than 150 mm from the edge of the adjacent face.
○ Existing asphalt or bituminous surfacing shall be saw cut for a sufficient depth to produce a neat vertical face.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Place bedding material to the minimum thicknesses (post-compaction) as per the IFC drawings (equal to or greater than the relevant Council drawings).
○ Bedding shall be trimmed to the appropriate levels, moistened as necessary, and firmly compacted.
○ The foundation shall be true to grade and cross section as shown on the drawings by filling and excavating as necessary.

○ All soft wet or unstable material shall be removed to a depth of not less than 100 mm below the design level of the underside of bedding and filled with bedding material moistened and compacted to form a stable foundation.
REFERENCE: IFC Drawings, COGD SD300 Series
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Designed and constructed in such a manner so it can be removed without damage to the concrete.
○ Formwork to be rigid, braced, full depth of the concrete & tied together to restrict movement during concreting operations to maintain dimensional comformance.
○ Joints in formwork shall be constructed such that loss of mortar is prevented.
○ Prior to placing concrete in an earth excavation, formwork shall be erected so that fresh concrete is not placed directly against the sides of the excavation.
REFERENCE: IFC Drawings 703.24, COGD SD300 Series
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Where applicable, construction joints shall be placed where the new construction ties into existing structures.
○ Consult the relevant Council Standard drawings for the joint detail, these may require:
i. Concrete cutting of a shear-key
iii. Drilling and insertion of dowel bars (may also be galvanised)
iv. Cutting a groove for sealant
○ Where it is necessary to join to an existing section of profile different from that being constructed, the change of profile shall be made at a constant rate between 10 and 20 mm per metre.
○ Transitions between different profiles shall be made in accordance with the drawings.
○ Matching of new to existing concrete paving shall be such that it appears identical to the existing section.
REFERENCE: IFC Drawings 703.26 (c), COGD SD300 Series
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Where applicable, isolation joints shall be placed:
i. around all abutting structures such as pits, utility services, power poles, kerbs and other such features
ii. at any location marked on the drawings
○ The joint shall be made with a compressable material extending for the full width and full depth of the paving and secured into position prior to concrete operations.
REFERENCE: IFC Drawings, COGD SD300 Series
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The correct mesh type and location as shown on the IFC drawings.
○ Any splice lengths achieve the minimum length and are in contact for this length.
○ The reinforcement surface condition is free from dirt, debris and damage.
○ The resulting cage securely held with sufficient ties and/or bar chairs to limit displacement or deformation during the concrete pour (typically 900mm crs maximum).
○ Wire chairs with or without plastic tips, bricks or pieces of timber or coarse aggregate shall not be used to support steel reinforcement.
○ Minimum cover of 50mm at edges has been achieved (including tie wire locations).
REFERENCE: IFC Drawings, COGD SD300 Series
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Inspection to ensure that forms, reinforcement dowels and other embedments conform to the requirements of the specifications and drawings.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Concrete shall not be placed when the air temperature at the point of placement is less than 5°C or greater than 35°C.
○ The temperature of concrete, measured immediately prior to placing, shall not be less than 10°C or greater than 32°C.
○ The air temperature, relative humidity, concrete temperature and wind velocity are measured to determine the evaporation rate of water from the concrete.
○ When the evaporation rate exceeds 0.50 kg/m²/hr apply evaporation retardant at the rates specified on the manufacturer’s TDS.
○ Record: Required information on the Concrete Pour Record.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Concrete cast in one continuous operation to be tested at a frequency as shown below: 0m³ to 50m³ = 1 sample
○ Each sample shall consist of 1 no. slump test and 2 no. compressive strength cylinders minimum.
○ Compressive strength cylinders = 2 no. 28 day strength.
○ Record: Required information on the Concrete Pour Record.
○ Record: Required information on the Concrete Pour Record.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Correct quantity of cylinders manufactured per sample.
○ Record: Required information on the Concrete Pour Record.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Concrete is supplied at an adequate rate to ensure no cold joints are formed.
○ Maximum elapsed time for discharge (including compaction) is 90 minutes from batching.
○ Concrete that stiffens or is showing signs of stiffening shall not be used.
○ If water is added once discharge commences, the volume shall not exceed the water-cement ratio for the mix design and the water volume is recorded on the concrete pour record.
○ Record: Required information on the Concrete Pour Record.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All concrete batches are traceable.
○ Where concrete pumps are used, the initial discharge is pumped to waste until a consistent workable mix is discharged.
○ Fresh concrete shall not be placed against concrete which has taken its initial set, except at properly formed construction joints.

○ Concrete shall be thoroughly compacted by means of continuous tamping and internal vibration and shall be worked around any embedments and into corners of formwork or excavations to produce a dense concrete free from voids, honeycombing, segregation or surface defects.
○ Vibration continued at each point until air bubbles cease to emerge from the concrete.
○ Unformed surfaces shall be hand tamped to ensure a smooth surface with a uniform colour and appearance, and screeded to achieve the specified level, dimensions, falls and tolerances.
○ Record: Required information on the Concrete Pour Record.
REFERENCE: IFC Drawings, COGD SD300 Series, 703.25
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Surface finish shall be as per the drawings or; as a minimum, finished to grade and cross section with a wooden float to produce a lightly textured non-skid surface.
○ All outside edges of slabs and all joints shall be finished with a suitable edging tool.
○ Vehicle crossings to have a bull nose (25mm max)
REFERENCE: IFC Drawings, COGD SD300 Series, 703.28

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The positions of any existing conduits passing under edgings shall be marked by a chase in the edging immediately above the conduit together with the nominated identification mark shown on the drawings.
REFERENCE: IFC Drawings, COGD SD300 Series, 703.26 (b) (ii)

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Crack-control joints shall be finished with a suitable edging tool, full-width of the pavement to the required depth and locations and/or longitudinal spacings as shown on the drawings.

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The curing of exposed concrete surfaces shall commence immediately after finishing operations are progressively completed either by water curing, wet hessian, polyethylene sheeting which is adequately sealed, curing compound or a combination of these.
○ Where curing compounds are used, 2 coats of the shall be applied in accordance with the manufacturer's TDS.

○ The curing membrane shall be maintained intact for not less than the specified period of curing. Any damage to the curing membrane during the period of curing shall be repaired immediately at the original rate of application
○ Curing shall continue uninterrupted for a period of not less than 7 days after placing the concrete, or 3 days for concrete edgings.
○ Freshly finished exposed concrete surfaces shall be effectively protected from rain or damage from other sources, until hard set has occurred.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All concrete shall be protected from damage from early loading by pedestrians, animals, vehicles and from rain or any other cause.

○ Suitable flagging, signage or bunding shall be erected to prevent vehicles from crossing over residential and/or commercial vehicle crossings a minimum of four days after completion of casting of the concrete. Vehicles greater than 1.5 tonnes may be permitted to cross after 7 days.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Formwork shall not be stripped until the minimum times have elapsed from the time of completion of the placing of concrete:
i. 2 days for vertical formwork on external surfaces; and
ii. 1 day for vertical forms on permanently hidden surfaces

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: At no earlier than 3 days after concrete placement, topsoil material shall be placed and firmly compacted in layers not exceeding 150 mm in thickness and to a width not less than 300 mm behind the edging to the top of the edging.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: No cracks greater than 0.2mm.
○ If cracking greater than this is observed follow Structural Concrete Crack Repair ITP for investigation and repair.
REFERENCE: IFC Drawings, Relevant Council Drawings, 703.25, 703.10 (a), AS3610 Clause 3.2
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: After finishing, all work shall present a consistently neat appearance of uniform colour.
○ All edges shall be sharp and clean and bullnoses shall be regular and of uniform radius.
○ At the end of the curing period, concrete paving and shared user paths shall provide a dense, hard wearing surface.
○ Where surface finishes are non-conforming follow Structural Concrete Patch Repair ITP for investigation and repair.
REFERENCE: IFC Drawings, Relevant Council Drawings, 703.11, Table 703.111
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: 28 day compressive strength (average of the 2 no. cylinders) per sample comply with the design strength.
○ Note: 1 of the 2 no. 28 day cylinders per sample may be as low as 90% of the required strength, so long as the average meets the required strength.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Provide record of dimensional measurements to demonstrate that all Works meet level and location requirements within the tolerances below:
○ Rate of change of deviation from RL or alignment = 10mm in 10m
○ Where median surfacings are to be constructed between edge sections of the same level, paving shall be crowned to produce a crossfall between 1% and 3% towards the edges.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure that any NCRs pertaining to the lot / element / Work area that this ITP covers, have been closed in CAMs.
FREQUENCY: Once, prior to closure of this lot / element / Work area

On behalf of Metropolitan Roads Program Alliance, it is hereby certified that the Works represented by the item of work listed above have been tested in accordance with the Project Quality Plan and conform in all respects with the requirements of the Contract.
ITP approved for use by: Victor Mira
Reference: VicRoads 720, AS 4454, AS 4419, IFC Drawings, Sub Contractor ITP
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure that all employees and subcontractors are:
– Using the correct and complete set of IFC drawings
– All drawings are the latest revision
FREQUENCY: Prior to Commencement of works
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Samples, records and certificates shall be provided to the Nominated Authority (NA) at least 10 working days prior to bulk delivery.
Following information shall be provided to the NA:
FREQUENCY: Prior to Commencement of works
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Site won topsoil to be tested to establish what soil amendments and macro and micro nutreints are required to be added to the top soil if required by planting subcontractor.
○ Where imported topsoil is used, the topsoil must conform to the properties specified in Table 720.042 and align with IFC Drawings .
METHOD: Verify, Doc. Review if applicable
FREQUENCY: Prior to Commencement of works
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: Sign ITP, Attach material conformance docs/Test Report
REFERENCE: Section 720.04, Table 720.044, AS4454, IFC Drawings
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Site mulch available from the chipping of on-site indigenous or non-weed vegetation shall be used where possible, otherwise approved mulch stated on IFC drawings.
○ All wood mulch to be spread in accordance to AS 4454 and conform to required depth stated in IFC drawings .
○ Imported Wood Mulch shall comply with Table 720.044.
METHOD: Verify, Doc. Review if applicable
FREQUENCY: Prior to Commencement of works
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: Sign ITP, Attach material conformance docs (if applicable)
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Subcontractor ITP to be reviewed and approved by MRPA.
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: Sign ITP, Attach completed Subcontractor ITP
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Refer to Subcontractor ITP
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: Sign ITP, Attach Test Report, Attached Delivery Docket (if applicable)
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Refer to Subcontractor ITP.
○ Do not proceed until the NA inspects and acknowledges requirements for ripping have been met.
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: Sign ITP, Attach Lot Map/Marked Up Area Inspected

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Site topsoil shall be used wherever possible, in preference to imported topsoil. Following subsoil preparation, topsoil shall be spread on planting areas and grassed areas in accordance with minimum top soil depths stated in table 720.071.
– Planting Areas in disturbed areas flatter than 3h:1v = 150mm Minimum
– Planting Areas in disturbed areas steeper than 3h:1v = 100mm Minimum
– Grassing in disturbed areas =75 mm, except 100 mm in swales
– Individual Tree Planting within grassed areas =150 mm in disturbed grassed areas
○ Topsoil shall be spread on planting areas and grassed areas.
○ Note: Topsoil shall not be compacted.
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: Sign ITP, Attach Delivery Dockets if applicable
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Do not proceed until the NA inspects & acknowledges requirements for topsoiling and cultivation have been met
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: Sign ITP, Attach Lot Map/Marked Up Area Inspected
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Refer to Subcontractor ITP
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: Sign ITP, Attach Delivery Dockets
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Refer to Subcontractor ITP
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: Sign ITP, Reference TeamBinder Material Approval No. if applicable, Attach Delivery Dockets

On behalf of Metropolitan Roads Program Alliance, it is hereby certified that the Works represented by the item of work listed have been tested in accordance with the Project Quality Plan and conform in all respects with the requirements of the Contract.
ITP approved for use by: Victor Mira
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure that all employees and subcontractors are using:
– The correct and complete set of drawings
– All drawings are the latest revision
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Samples, records and certificates shall be provided to the Superintendent at least 10 working days prior to bulk delivery.
○ Following information shall be provided to the superintendent:
○ Inspections of plant stock for all plant species
– Evidence of origin of indigenous provenance plant material
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: This ITP, Attach Records to TeamBinder Approval Form
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All plants shall be of the type, height, container size and trunk caliper specified in the Plant Schedules, Specification and Planting Plans.
○ Plants are to conform to the supply properties specified in Table 720.041
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: A species listed on the planting schedule shall be classed as an indigenous plant if the plant is likely to have occurred within 10 km of the project site (pre 1750).
○ The Contractor shall submit documentation of origin of indigenous provenance plant material which shall include the following details for each seed lot:
○ Approximate number of parent plants sampled
○ Approximate number of plants in that local population
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Grass seed shall comply with Table 720.045
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Trial planting sections have been approved by the Superintendent. These approved sections shall be used as a reference for the remaining planting works
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The Contractor shall develop and implement site specific pest and weed management procedures to control pest and weed populations.
○ Pre-planting weed control shall be undertaken to ensure that planting areas and new grassed areas are free of visible weeds prior to the commencement of planting and grassing.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Planting areas are to be set out to the location and shape specified in the landscape drawings.
○ Plant density requiremens and planting offsets established in the plant schedule are to be adhered to.

○ Individual plants shall be located in accordance with the drawings such that the mature form of the plant will be in accordance with VicRoads Road Design Guidelines, including clear zone and sight distance requirements.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All planting will be undertaken in accordance to Ecodynamics ITP ECO-LANF-005
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ecodynamics ITP signed and completed
FREQUENCY: Following completion of planting works
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: Sub-Contractor ITP completed, signed and to be attached

On behalf of Metropolitan Roads Program Alliance, it is hereby certified that the Works represented by the item of work listed have been tested in accordance with the Project Quality Plan and conform in all respects with the requirements of the Contract.
